items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-288-3136. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
In order to provide a more consistent schedule to the public and avoid the need for special board meetings, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees choose one of the following three options for the 2010--2011 board meeting schedule:
	 
Option 1 (copy attached) - Maintains the same scheduled dates approved by the Board in May. The only change reflected in this option is, due to the August 3 Special Board Meeting being held at the District Board Room, the meeting venues have been changed for the remaining meetings.
	 
Option 2 (copy attached) - With the exception of December due to holiday shutdown, the Board of Trustees will schedule two Regular Governing Board Meetings per month. The 2nd meeting of the month will be held on an as-needed basis; and, if required, the meeting agenda will be posted within the 72-hr. Brown Act requirement. 
	 
Option 3 (copy attached) - The Board of Trustees will schedule five additional regular Governing Board Meetings -- two meetings will be held in the months of October, November, January, March, and May; if necessary, and the meeting agenda will be posted within the 72-hr. Brown Act requirement.

items.item_details:
The District desires a way to financially support the implementation of the 2025 Educational Master Plans of the colleges that were approved by the Board of Trustees in July 2010 and the Facilities Master Plan of the District, which will be completed in December 2010.  These plans require necessary funding for facility, technology and basic infrastructure repairs that are required for instructional programs and services that support student success.
	 
There are currently no state resources allocated for these purposes, and given the economic condition of the state, resources will likely be minimally available in the future.  The District has successfully passed Measure I in 1998 and Measure G in 2004 to support capital projects in the District, but the majority of the projects associated with these bonds have been completed.
	 
Recent surveys indicate community support for those projects which upgrade and replace classrooms and labs, improve infrastructure, increase energy efficiency and reduce operating costs, ensure accessibility for disabled students, and make sure that technology is current for teaching and learning.
	 
This resolution directs the Chancellor to consider ways to fund the Master Plans, including planning for a local bond election at the earliest authorized date in  2012 and report to the Board of Trustees periodically as to the steps that are being taken to prepare for such an election.
items.item_recommendation: Approve a resolution that declares the District's need for a capital facilities bond.
